intro: Stenanthemum bilobum, commonly known as the two-lobed stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Epacridae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in heathland and open forest environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with a tubular shape and prominent lobes. Stenanthemum bilobum is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
